explanation: Funds are required to pay for mandays in the Special Training program supporting the Army Reserve (USAR) Sustainment Command (ARSC) DoD Acquisition Workforce Fund (DAWDF) Functional Skill Development initiative. The DAWDF allows USAR Troop Program Unit (TPU) Soldiers to receive valuable on-the-job training experience and gain proficiency in contracting and program management to meet the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DA WIA) certification standards. The TPU Soldier's Battle Training Assembly does not provide sufficient time to gain experience or become proficient in contracting processes and procedures. This action does not change the purpose for which the funds were originally appropriated. This is a base budget requirement.

Funds are required to provide Advanced Trauma Training for Air National Guard personnel assigned to the CBRNE Enhanced Response Force Package (CERFP) and the Homeland Response Force (HRF). Funds will be used to offset costs associated with the Air National Guard Medical Service (ANGMS) trauma training platforms. Funding will be used to cover workday and travel costs incurred by guardsmen. Funds were added in the Operation and Maintenance (O&M), Army National Guard, 15/15, appropriation and need to be realigned to the Military Personnel, Air National Guard, 15/15, appropriation for proper execution. This is a base budget requirement.

Funds are available because they were erroneously appropriated to the Operation and Maintenance, Army National Guard, 15/15, appropriation under Budget Activity (BA) 01 Operating Forces and need to be transferred to the Military Personnel, Air National Guard, 15/15, appropriation under BA 01 Reserve Component Training and Support and the Operation and Maintenance, Air National Guard, 15/15, appropriation under BA 01 Operating Forces for proper execution of Emergency Medical Training activities performed by Air National Guardsmen, This is in compliance with congressional intent and language. This is base budget funding.
